abstract: Even though President Wilson’s peace speech was coldly received in France, the Socialist group in the French Parliament would like the government to affirm its agreement with him.
lead_paragraph: PARIS — President Wilson’s peace speech has been rather coldly received in France, but the Socialist group in the Chamber is an exception. The group, which assembled yesterday morning, voted the following motion:
snippet: Even though President Wilson’s peace speech was coldly received in France, the Socialist group in the French Parliament would like the government to affirm its agreement with him....

headline.main: 1917: President Wilson’s Speech Sways French Socialists
